org.eng.util

Class RepeatingCallable

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eng.util.RepeatingCallable

  • public class RepeatingCallable
extends Object
    Provides the ability to repeatedly call a Callable in another thread.
    Author:
    dawood

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Callable<Integer> callable 
      protected boolean isRunning 
      protected boolean isStarted 
      protected Thread runner 
      protected String threadName 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RepeatingCallable(String threadName, Callable<Integer> callable) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isStarted() 
      void start()
      Start the thread that will repeatedly call the Callable in this instance.
      void stop()
      Stop the thread that is running the Callable from this instance.

    • Field Detail

      • threadName

        protected final String threadName

        protected final Callable<Integer> callable

        protected boolean isStarted

      • isRunning

        protected boolean isRunning

      • runner

        protected Thread runner

    • Constructor Detail

      • RepeatingCallable

        public RepeatingCallable(String threadName,
                         Callable<Integer> callable)
        Parameters:
        threadName - name to give to the thread. Can be null in which case the simple name of the callable class will be used.
        callable - a callable that is called repeatedly in another thread. The return value of its call() method is the number of milliseconds to sleep the thread before calling call() again.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
           throws Exception
        Start the thread that will repeatedly call the Callable in this instance.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop the thread that is running the Callable from this instance. The thread is interrupted, but if the Callable.call() method is not interruptable this will not return until the Callable.call() method has returned.

      • isStarted

        public boolean isStarted()
